website_summaries.verdict: A heavy-duty machine-made chain mail scrubber made to last.
pros: Machine soldering makes it very durable
Can scrape off the grit without stripping your seasoning
Doesn't need to be oiled to prevent rusting
Works on the dirtiest pans without you having to bring out the soap
Can also work on a variety of other surfaces
cons: If you scrub too hard with this model, you can take off the seasoning

customer_reviews.title: Made in China! They lied on description
customer_reviews.text: Not made in North America like the listing says! Paid 20 dollars for this and it says made in China, see pictures. So disappointed in this scam
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stripped my seasoning!!
customer_reviews.text: Stripped my seasoning down to bare metal with minimal pressure. Maybe fine if you have factory seasoning, but would stay away if you’ve built your own seasoning up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Destroyed 60 years of seasoning on a Griswold skillet
customer_reviews.text: Don't trust all the 5 star reviews. I cook with cast iron all the time, never used soap or anything over the years to protect the seasoning. I saw the overwhelmingly good reviews for the Ringer, and so I bought thinking it would make cleanup easier without damaging the pans. I've attached pictures of my skillet after using the ringer a few times. This item stripped the seasoning right off my favorite vintage Griswold cast iron skillet. That's 60+ years of seasoning I'll never get back, thanks to this cheap piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: kathryn

customer_reviews.title: The item I received from Fashionstorm is not The Ringer ...
customer_reviews.text: The item I received from Fashionstorm is not The Ringer, it is a counterfeit knockoff. The ring on the knockoff is blank without the manufacturers information (shown in the product photo).
customer_reviews.author: WP a

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It is Not Soldered as advertised in listing. The ends are open same as less expensive ones.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald T.

customer_reviews.title: This took off the cooked finish of my cast iron.
customer_reviews.text: First this is really funky, a piece of mesh chain. But I gave it a try. The chain link just kind of skitters around. It did no better than ANYTHING else I had at my Kitchen Sink to clean my Cast Iron Skillet. Really. And worse, it took off the cooking finish from my loved 10.5" Lodge Skillet. Do not purchase. My yellow smiling cleaning pad worked just as well. Thank you! Happy Cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Stan Caswell

customer_reviews.title: The item I received was a knockoff.
customer_reviews.text: I received a knockoff. The point where the chains are smoldered have very sharp edges. I tested it by gently rubbing it on my arm and there are scratches everywhere on my arm. I can't imagine how this won't damage the cast iron. I am returning it. Also, it doesn't have the location of manufactured stamped like the image. The item I received was in a small baggie with a business card.
customer_reviews.author: blue22

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for removing seasoning
customer_reviews.text: I now have to re-season my nearly perfectly seasoned cast iron pan thanks to this contraption. I was extremely gentle and only used it once and it removed nearly all of the seasoning. Bacon even sticks to the pan now 🤬
customer_reviews.author: Angela C

customer_reviews.title: The Dead Ringer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to clean my cast iron pans. You have got to be kidding me. I'm sending this bad joke back back to where it came from. Goodbye !!!
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Waxter III

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: We use two cast iron skillets that belonged to my wife's grandmother (maybe Great grandmother). We season them regularly. We have always just used the cheap wire bristle pads available at any grocery. We tried this product. We did not see an improvement in cleaning. It was a bit harder to use as the old wire pads are easier to hold on to. The biggest problem is that they easily slide down the drain and into the garbage disposal. And it takes a strong magnet to get it out. To us, this product offered no advantage over far cheaper products.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This product did not meet my quality expectations. Based on the price paid I was expecting something more substantial and feel like I was duped . . . It is made from light-weight materials and is hard to hold. It is a good concept, but, should be at least the size of a normal dish cloth and made with heavier chain-mail.
customer_reviews.author: Paul J Mercier Jr

customer_reviews.title: Not what you're looking for...
customer_reviews.text: I really expected a lot more. The problem with it is it's so small it's hard to use. You can wrap it around a sponge it will cover about half the sponge (it's stretched in the add I think) but then the sponge gets soiled with the grease. The positive side is it cleaned up very easy and it is a better astetic than a grimy Brilo pad. I'll look for a larger one online and return this one if I can. It's a good idea but this company is probably not selling what you're looking for. Just found this one
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: It ruined my Lodge seasoning after one gentle use
customer_reviews.text: How could this item have positive reviews?? I read many reviews and watched videos to make sure I use this ringer right. I also went through a lot of headache to have it shipped internationally. But what a disappointment, I very gently used it on my Lodge skillet, just the one time, and it stripped off the seasoning I worked so hard to get (with flaxseed oil after each and every use). The skillet also lost its shine. I have been fooled by the positive reviews yet again.
customer_reviews.author: bb

customer_reviews.title: No Soap or Soaking Needed
customer_reviews.text: Too much soaking will hasten the de-seasoning of a cast iron pan, and soap is right out. So what to do when scrambled eggs, or other high-adhesion foods (like squash soup) leave stuff behind in your cast iron cookware? That's where THE RINGER comes in. Hot tap water + the Ringer = clean cast iron - and quickly. And I have noticed that the seasoning on my pans is lasting much longer. One tip: Do not let this stray under your fingernails when using! It will be painful for sure. So be mindful of that. Otherwise - a must have for folks who cook with cast iron.
customer_reviews.author: Missouri Man

customer_reviews.title: Must have if you own a cast iron
customer_reviews.text: The Ringer makes using a cast iron pan easy and low maintenance. I no longer need heaps of salt and a paper towel to remove food. With a few swishes of the Ringer on the pan under running water, the pan is clean and ready to go. Then I wash the Ringer with a bit of soap to remove the oil and dirt and hang it up to dry. I would feel gross using a dirty sponge to clean a cast iron pan since you can't use soap on it, and the salt and paper towel technique is wasteful. The Ringer is both sanitary and good for the environment. If you own a cast iron, you need this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Kristoff

customer_reviews.title: If you love your cast iron, get it!
customer_reviews.text: This chain mail for cast iron pans is amazing. Gets them nice and clean with nothing but water and can then safely be cleaned with soap itself since it rinses so easily and thoroughly, it won’t hold onto soap residue that will steal your seasoning. Brillo pads have nothing on these guys. I’m back for a second because we had a garbage disposal mishap. NOT recommended! Keep your disposal covered when using and do not drape it over the center of the sink to dry. They’re surprisingly slippery and will slide into the drain where they’ll do a number on your disposal when your partner doesn’t realize it slipped in.
customer_reviews.author: EB

customer_reviews.title: Believer Now
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Ringer begrudgingly a few months ago. At almost $22, it cost more than some of my most prized Lodge cast iron skillets. Nevertheless, after a few months now, and after using various bristle brushes from Lodge and other third-parties, the Ringer is the only thing that has consistently improved my cast iron pots and skillets. I don’t know how or why, but it keeps my seasoned cast iron pots/pans very smooth and it effectively cleans off all the crumbly bits left behind by most brushes. Totally worth what I paid as I understand now the value of having this if I want to care for my cast iron pots/pans with little effort.
customer_reviews.author: leizl

customer_reviews.title: really works on cast iron cookware -
customer_reviews.text: I've used the ringer a couple of times now on a 12" Lodge frying pan with success in removing food that is stuck to the pan without using detergent. The ringer's concept of using interlinked stainless steel hoops cleans the pans without scratching the surface of the cast iron pan. I do need to use detergent to rinse off the ringer after using it to remove residual oil attached to the ringer; and , it is good to go the next time.
customer_reviews.author: pacifico

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. I love it.
customer_reviews.text: We are new to cast iron pans and after purchasing and using one, quickly realized we had no idea how to actually clean it. I wish I had bought this sooner. It is amazing. I’m seriously thinking about giving this as a Christmas stocking gift to my siblings- seriously, it is that good. It works quickly and efficiently, but because of the design you don’t lose the important tactile sense. I can still feel where there are bumps of cooked on food, which isn’t the case with a mass of steel wool. This rinses easily too.
customer_reviews.author: Kirstenmont

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding product--changed my Cast Iron Life!
customer_reviews.text: I've been a "sea salt and water" guy for cleaning my cast iron for thirty years, but I recently heard about this product and decided to give it a try. It is outstanding--the seasoning on my cast iron has never been cleaner and smoother--what a delight. After only a few weeks, my pans look like they were mirror polished before seasoning. Unlike the lodge chainmail scrubber, this doesn't have a sponge inside it to trap grease or flakes--it rinses easily, and can be sterilized in your dishwasher. If you own Lodge or any other cast iron cookware, GET ONE OF THESE--it will change your life...
customer_reviews.author: Dreamer23

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I ever know chain mail was a great scrubber?!
customer_reviews.text: Very, very good scrubber. More aggressive than a green scotch pad but doesn't scrub the seasoning off at all. Also works great for scrubbing anything - pyrex casseroles, non stick pans, etc. Cons are that it's not made from a very strong metal and its started to lose rings after just a short while, and its slippery/easy to lose track of.
customer_reviews.author: jtablerd

customer_reviews.title: Great for cleaning my pan
customer_reviews.text: Okay, not sure why they list scent as a ranking criteria....I mean, it's a stainless steel chain-mail scrubber, why would it have any scent. Anyway, after I get done cooking with my cast iron pans, I put a little oil in them to soak into any cooked on food, then when the pan cools, I use this and it takes the stuck on food right off of my pan. I wipe it clean when I am done and it makes it a joy to cook with my cast iron pans. I tried scrubbing with a regular towel previously and was frustrated that some of the food would just not come off, this makes quick work of stuck on food.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Don't believe the negative reviews.
customer_reviews.text: I almost didn't buy this because of the harsh negative reviews calling it a cheap knock off, it fell apart easily, or that it will ruin the seasoning on the pan. I think some may be reviewing the wrong product because their descriptions of the rings were off. I didn't need to scrub hard to take off cooked on egg, seasoning was maintained, it hasn't fallen apart nor does it seem like it would. Perhaps if you scrubbed really hard it would take off the seasoning. But if you follow the instructions, you shouldn't need to scrub hard. Its a quality product. I'd recommend it without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron M.

customer_reviews.title: Got cast iron? YOU NEED THIS
customer_reviews.text: At first I though, “are these great reviews really true?” Well being the good southerner that I am, I knew that a well seasoned cast iron was better than gold & I must protect it from the evils of harsh cleaning. YALL. THIS THING WORKS. It is amazing how effortless it is to use. So yeah, you could suit up for medieval battle, or you could clean your cast iron without becoming haunted by your southern ancestors & Nanny Viola won’t come back from the grave to tan your hide from ruining the seasoning on the heirloom cast iron skillets. Get this. You won’t regret it!
customer_reviews.author: name withheld

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase in a long time
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolute game changer if you like cooking with cast iron or carbon steel woks. I use it on both and it's amazing. A little warm water, some elbow grease (but not a ton unless you're restoring an old pan), and a wipe off. That's it. The product is a little smaller than it looks in the photos but its not a big deal at all. I'll buy another one if this one ever wears out. Its easy to clean, well made, and extremely effective. I would highly recommend this to anyone who uses cast iron cookwear or carbon steel woks.
customer_reviews.author: ____Top Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: If you love your cast iron, you should put a ring on it
customer_reviews.text: This has worked great for many of the stubborn scraps that don't come off the cast-iron with the plastic scraper. I originally was going to try with a different off-brand, but I'm glad I went with The Ringer. It's cleaned my cast-irons dozens and dozens of times already. Does a great job quickly and it's easy to rinse clean. The Ringer also still looks brand new and shiny. I would definitely buy again if I were ever to lose mine. It's holding up wonderfully, so the only way I'd buy this again would be a gift to a fellow cast-iron user.
customer_reviews.author: Draddots

customer_reviews.title: Cast Iron Cookware Made Easy
customer_reviews.text: The "Ringer" works so good I bought 7 more for our camping cook-box, our home kitchen, daughter's and son's kitchen. If your cast iron is cured properly this stainless steel chainmail scrubber works great at removing scorched and even burned on deposits without leaving a residue. It is best used as a daily scrubber removing the little bits of gradoo while seasoning the pan.A quick rinse with water and back on the heat to dry. Rinse the Ringer off with water; done. If the Ringer gets really dirty simply hang the bigger ring over wire post in your dishwasher and it comes out spotless.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick Wilson

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great!
customer_reviews.text: This scrubber totally takes the hassle out of cleaning your cast iron skillet. It doesn't matter how greasy it is or how much fried-on gook is on the pan, you can now clean it with just hot water and some elbow grease. Having some seasoning helps: the more seasoning, the less elbow grease needed. Does not remove the seasoning. Beginners: There is now no reason not to use your cast iron skillet!
customer_reviews.author: valerie hunter

customer_reviews.title: Good on large particles, not so good on detail work
customer_reviews.text: I love that this scrapes off the majority of larger stuck on food particles and doesn't trap the food in the rings, but it doesn't handle the smaller pieces well at all. More than once, a ring has gotten jammed under my nail while swishing it around a pan, which of course is not pleasant. I typically use this first, then grab my stainless steel scrubber on my sink for a final swipe - like using different grits of sandpaper, course to finer. Will still use it, but it's definitely an addition to the kitchen, it doesn't replace what I already used.
customer_reviews.author: Kai

customer_reviews.title: Use this almost daily on cast iron and steel pans. Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for a month or so now. Use it often, as we cook with cast iron a lot. I've found it best to clean pans shortly after cooking, while they are still hot. I put the pan in the sink and add a little hot water. Using a silicone glove I scrub. This works quite well and it take no time to maintain a pan that's been caught up and was clean before use. I used this on a steel pan that we had for years and was really stained. I got it 100% immaculate .. as new with a little elbo grease and this tool. Definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Beaulieu

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: Very durable. It feel in my garbage disposal, while it was on, when I got it out. No damage Where was this when I bought my first cast iron? Hot water and this, that's all you need. It makes cleaning so easy, I barely need to rinse my pan first. It strips food and sauce right off the pan as I scrub under warm water. It felt a little weird at first as I was used to throughly rinsing my pan, but after I got past the texture difference I was very impressed. As needed I toss it in the dishwasher to clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: Ultimate Cleaning Tool
customer_reviews.text: This tool is essential for anyone with a cast iron pot/pan. Before I had this, I'd spend forever scrubbing down my cast iron trying to get off all the little burnt crust that got baked on from use. And even after all that, I still wouldn't be able to get everything off. But this is a real game-changer, really lets you get all of that off with minimal pressure. The chains are rounded so you don't get any scratches or wear off any of the seasoning either. I highly recommend you ditch your sponge and upgrade to this for cleaning your cast iron. Your hands will definitely thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Omar A.

customer_reviews.title: So good, I bought 3
customer_reviews.text: Short and sweet review: Bought #1, loved it, accidentally sent it down the garbage disposal... Bought #2, still love it, but this time I have a hook to hang it on and a cover for my disposal. Bought #3 for my FIL, who wanted a cast iron pan for his birthday. As far as I know, he thinks it works well!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny K

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing. I have tried all suggested ways of cleaning my cast iron pans and getting any stuck on food to come off. I have used kosher salt in the past. I would have to apply the salt several times. I saw this and thought it would work about the same. I was hesitant to spend the money but figured the price meant quality. I am so glad I splurged. It is amazing! I cleaned my pan, as I usually do with hot water and a sponge. Whatever food remained was easily removed with “The Ringer”. I was very pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Maddie

customer_reviews.title: clean up is easy,  improves performance
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to clean my cast iron skillet with. I tried everything else, and I still had some stuck on bits- next time I used the pan it caused problems. Well, this baby worked like a charm! nothing but a smooth clean pan! and that smoothness made the next time I used the skillet a wonderful experience. I then used it to scrub the crumb tray in my counter oven, again with amazing results! It works so much better than a scrubber or steel wool soap pad on my other cleaning chores. When done, I simply soaped it up, rinsed, and allowed it to air dry. Best little gizmo I've purchased in a while
customer_reviews.author: AM225

customer_reviews.title: Strips the season away
customer_reviews.text: Strips all of the season off of your cast iron. Do not buy this product if you care about the quality of your pan!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly  and is a step up from the nylon net for oranges that had its job previously.
customer_reviews.text: It is a tool which works well for those people that can afford to pay that much for a simple tool. I like it, but wouldn't have bought it if money was as difficult to find as when I was a single dad. It seems to fit in well with the cast-iron ethos and upscale, LL Bean, rustic, urban culture of which I so strive to ascribe.
customer_reviews.author: Gilgamesh

customer_reviews.title: I Love this scrubber gadget!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I was skeptical about purchasing it at first, but now a year or two later - realize it is a must have. If you think about how much you spend on other sponges, green scrubbies, and what not, this is a bargain I have thrown away so many other kitchen cleaning gadgets, but this one looks like new at all times! Plus it is essential for getting burnt crusties off my cast iron (and stainless steel, and any other thing I don't mind scuffing up)
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Best Scrubber Ever!!
customer_reviews.text: So I used this the first time after searing chicken on the stovetop - that had been marinated in a balsamic vinegar, olive oil & garlic marinade - and then finished it in the oven. There was one particular spot on the bottom of the cast iron skillet that I would never have gotten off without using a metal spatula to scrape it off first and then finishing with another type of scrubber. The Ringer took care of it without much work at all. Thanks for such a great product. I’ll order one for my son now that I love mine so much.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Invention Since Cast Iron!
customer_reviews.text: I have a cast iron pan that's at least 100 years old and sometimes food sticks to it. The Ringer, a simple piece of stainless chainmail, not only makes cast iron cleanup fast and easy but it won't remove your pan's patina. Simply warm the pan, scrub with The Ringer, rinse, dry, coat with a thin layer of Canola oil and you're done. After use, I wash off my Ringer and hang it over a small open jar next to the stove. Highly recommend this to anyone using cast iron .
customer_reviews.author: L. Burr

customer_reviews.title: No better than other products that can be used for more than just cast iron
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a good idea for cleaning my cast iron skillets, but doesn't work any better than the green scrubbers I keep around for a variety of uses. I eventually tossed it out. It was just taking up space and didn't have any purpose I couldn't fill with things I already have.
customer_reviews.author: BKW

customer_reviews.title: This REALLY works!
customer_reviews.text: We were skeptical that this would really work, but with the money back guarantee we decided to take a chance. Our household uses several cast iron pans every day, so if this could do the job and replace the scouring pads we’ve been using and paying for to replace - that would be great. It did a GREAT job, and was easy to use and easy to clean. Suggestion - lay the Ringer down flat in the pan, and with water in the pan move it around cleaning all that needs to be removed. Don’t wad up the Ringer, I think that would actually make the process take longer. I definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie D

customer_reviews.title: Great for getting crud off your cast iron.
customer_reviews.text: You don't need to go crazy to clean a pan with this. A little soap, a few passes and a tiny bit of abrasion and stuff comes off your pan nice and easy with this. It won't mess up your pan, but if you have some poor quality seasoning coats, it might cause them to come off if you get a bit heavy with it. I haven't had any issues of the sort on my 16 inch old cast iron monster. I like how easy it is to clean afterwards and that it can double for getting caked on gunk off plates quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Osbon (Incognis)

customer_reviews.title: Works excellent, and better than a competing product
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these a few years ago and had been using it until about 2 months ago. It worked excellent. Somehow it got lost. I assume it was accidentally thrown out. My wife bought what she thought was the same one from Amazon. It just didn't work as well. It was like it didn't have the same number of edges, if that makes sense. So I found my original order from a few years ago, and used the "buy again". Sure enough, this works as well as the original one I had!
customer_reviews.author: mike ingoglia

customer_reviews.title: Scratches your pans
customer_reviews.text: It does scratch up your pans. Scratches up my cast irons and my stainless.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Gardner

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS PRODUCT RIGHT NOW!
customer_reviews.text: I almost never write a review because, face it, most things are "fine." Most everything I get does the job I want it to do well enough. But, this chain scrubber is amazing for cleaning my cast iron skillet. I'm a 64-year-old Southern grandmother who will leave my precious cast iron to whichever grandchild I love the most, and this scrubber will go with it. It took me about 30 seconds to clean my skillet without having to scrub enough to wear through the seasoning. Of course, I still put a few drops of oil in after cleaning, but it kept its finish beautifully. I have cooked in cast iron for 50 years and this is a game changer.
customer_reviews.author: B.Gardener

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculously easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Sure, you could go out and buy some metal something or other or use one of those plastic pan scrapers but this cleaner is a WINNER! It is incredibly easy to use. It is completely flexible so I can always find room for it in my BBQ stuff. It's easy to clean (soapy water, rinse, lay or hang flat, dry) and size is perfect. At first, I thought it was too big but I've found this size balls up perfectly in my hand when I want to scrub into the corners. I wouldn't change a thing.
customer_reviews.author: Clearlyclaire

customer_reviews.title: Worse than a grill brush.
customer_reviews.text: This mess is SO difficult to hang on to that I wasn’t able to accomplish anything. It’s shape is long and narrow, and the size is too small. A good brush works much better.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Bookaholic

customer_reviews.title: It's simply amazing!
customer_reviews.text: i have a lot of cast iron cookware, and was having difficulty getting rid of the small amounts of food getting stuck to it. This ringer is prefect!! Doesn't scratch the pan at all! When i'm done scrubbing my skillet, i just put some dawn dish soap in the palm of my hand with the ringer and wash off all the grease. I try it off with a paper towel and hang to dry more (this way i prevent any rust - i don't even know if it will rust, but i just wanna be on the safe side)
customer_reviews.author: Andrijana

customer_reviews.title: Works just like they said it would
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cleaner for cast iron. It doesn't take off the patina on the skillet I use every day. After cleaning the skillet, I just wipe it off and put a new film of oil on it so the skillet is ready to use again. The Ringer cleans just what it needs to and doesn't over clean the cast iron. The Ringer also doesn't retain food particles and so it doesn't get mildew build up. To really clean it, just hang it in the dishwasher and it comes out perfect.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great product but 3/5 on versatility and here is why
customer_reviews.text: For a cast iron pan without ridges, this is the item for you! Great construction, particles rinse right off, flexible. Here is why I gave a 3/5 on versatility. I bought this after getting a ridged cast iron pan. While this product works magic on my standard round flat cast iron skillet, the ridged pan is quite difficult to clean. However, do not let this dissuade from getting this product, it is a high quality product with good value and makes a good addition to your cast iron set.
customer_reviews.author: ACarter

customer_reviews.title: The Ringer WORKS, and Stands Up To The Test Of Time
customer_reviews.text: There are other chain mail scrubbers available, but “The Ringer uses premium grade never rusting stainless steel that is machine soldered, and built for strength.” The links don’t separate, being well soldered. I also like that it’s made in America. If you look to other brands, be sure to check for soldered links. I think this thing will last at least as long as my cast iron pans! If it gets yucky from cleaning a particularly messy pan, I just scrub it with a soapy brush, or run it through the dishwasher. I’ve had mine for over 5 years, and it looks brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Susan K.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: I love the product. I wish I had known about it when I first got my cast iron skillet over a year ago. It is really easy to use and did a great job getting the crud off of the skillet without stripping the seasoning away and it was fast. I find myself using my cast iron more frequently since purchasing this product because I no longer dread the cleanup process. If you have cast iron cookware then you need one of these babies. I will definitely recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: KeCaRi

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Tool to Clean Stubborn Cast Iron Pans!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a game changer for cleaning cast iron pans. Even the especially hard-to-clean grill pans come out perfectly with this tool. If you are thinking about getting this, stop reading and order it now. If you are still reading because you are skeptical or unsure, I can tell you I am in no way affiliated with this company— I just ordered this product based on reviews and I’m so glad I did! I also got one for my son because it has made cleaning cast iron so easy— no more stuck-on pieces of food!
customer_reviews.author: Helmax

customer_reviews.title: Luv it!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, I like the larger circle for hanging. It's gotten a bit yucky/greasy after use, but I just tossed it in a glass of super hot water with some dish soap and was good as new. Prior to this I used salt and a towel, this gets more "stuff" off, but sometimes I still use a little salt, I like the way it takes out more of the uneanted grease, but not the seasoning. I feel like it's a very special way to care for cast iron... and is GREAT with the griddle! I almost forgot about that!
customer_reviews.author: Madame Shops A'Lotte

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great to remove food bits from cast, carbon, and stainless pans without being too agressive on the metal or seasoning. Wish it was a little larger, and wish there was an option with a handle like the ones with square sponges on it (it tends to rough up your finger tips if you have to do a lot of scrubbing).
customer_reviews.author: FCLE

customer_reviews.title: JUST TRY IT!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know why I didn’t get one of these years ago. I’ve been cooking my whole life. I’ve always kind of avoided my cast iron because I never liked cleaning it. I’ve always used hot water and/or salt with oil. This works soooo much better. I looked as several chainmail cleaners. Some had mixed reviews. This one has wonderful reviews so I decided I to try it. It removes everything except the seasoning layer. I also purchased the “Lodge” pot scrubber to go along with it. The combination works great. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Cowboy’s wife

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I find I'm using my cast iron skillets more often, as it's easier to clean them with this. I don't understand the reviews that say it's too small. Just ball it up, and scrub. I even squirt some Dawn into it, but the seasoning on my pans is so good that they can withstand a tiny squirt of Dawn. If I don't squirt some Dawn into it before scrubbing a pan, I always squirt some in afterwards, work it in well, and rinse in hot water after, to keep it clean. Green scrubbies will get gross and have to be thrown out and replaced. This will last for a long long time.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta L. Gay

customer_reviews.title: It's like the high grit sandpaper of dish washing
customer_reviews.text: First, this product does a great job of removing baked on larger food items. Scrambled eggs are my nemesis with any other cleaning contraption. The Ringer grinds through food particles like high grade sand paper through balsa wood. The problem is, the finer details get missed. So a finer grit, if you will, cleaning device is needed. Fortunately, I have scrubbers my grandmother-in-law made that get the rest of the misses fine particles out. Together, cleaning caked on stuff is no match.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher D Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy - weight not as described.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a previous chain mail cast iron cleaner that I'd inadvertently dropped into my garbage disposal. thinking that the thousands of 5-star reviews would make this the best of all options, I was stunned to find this puny 2.68 ounce item in my mailbos today. The item description states the weight as 8 ounces, so I was expecring an item of equal size and weight to my previous one. This is thinner, flimsier, and not at all what I wanted. It's going back for a rfeund and I'll reorder what i had in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Roni Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Now I don't hesitate to use my cast iron.
customer_reviews.text: I use the ringer and think it's just great. All I have to do is put in a little warm water. It cleans my cast iron pan with a minimum of fuss, and after a quick scrub with the ringer, I empty out the warm water and dry the pan with a soft cloth. I put the ringer in the utensil holder of my dishwasher to clean of the "oily" feel after scrubbing. My cast iron pan is in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: LOL

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: It seems cool. And it's well made. I use this ringer for the first round if I have a hard crust; but I need to use a non-scratch sponge with a bit of liquid soap to finish it off. Else it leaves a layer of organic matter than turns black with repeated heating.
customer_reviews.author: esseyo

customer_reviews.title: This works!
customer_reviews.text: This is the bomb. I know it's overpriced, but it the best solution for cleaning your cast iron skillet in my opinion. Simple, fast, efficient, and no cleaning agent. I also use it to clean glassware/Pyrex if I have cooked something like lasagna and cheese is burned into the pan. The only negative is that if you're cleaning cheese products, it can get stuck in the chainmail, and there is no elegant solution to get the gunk out. I ended up throwing the Ringer in the washing machine - and that did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Cast iron must have
customer_reviews.text: This and a bit of oil are the only things you need to clean cast iron. I loved mine so much I ordered another for my friend who is a cast iron fanatic. It takes the food off with out messing up the seasoning. This and the man kitchen spatula that I named “spatchy” are my two fav cast iron add ons. The price point is pretty high in my opinion but honestly when you consider that it has a life time warranty and works like a champ who cares?
customer_reviews.author: arh

customer_reviews.title: The Ringer
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived early, which is always good. I am new to using cast iron. I have a cast iron skillet and a cast iron chef's pan. I have read so many things to do regarding cast iron. Some say to never wash, some say to wash, others say use a scraper. I tried all of these and both skillet and pan had some burnt areas as a result. I purchased The Ringer, and just used warm water to scrub the pan and skillet, and the results were great. I no longer worry about residue. Thanks for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher H.

customer_reviews.title: Everyone who cooks with cast iron should have this!
customer_reviews.text: My cast iron pan is well-used and well-seasoned but cleaning can still be problematic at times, particularly after cooking stinky (fish, bacon) foods. My husband usually cleans the pans because I hate it so and he thinks The Ringer is amazing. I no longer think about whether to cook certain things in that pan because cleaning it is now easy and effective. After using The Ringer I chuck it in the dishwasher and it's ready for next time. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Happilyretired

customer_reviews.title: One Ring Fell off After First Use
customer_reviews.text: Used my cast iron this morning knowing this would be delivered today. Immediately took it out to use it. Unfortunately, one ring fell off with simple use. Cleaned really well, but quality seems shoddy. Disappointed based on all the positive reviews.
customer_reviews.author: aMum

customer_reviews.title: Not ‘The Ringer’
customer_reviews.text: I was one of the unfortunate ones to receive a ‘knock-off’. The metal loops are large. It is matte and does not appear to be stainless steel. The hanging ring is a regular keychain style ring and not a thick ring that says ‘The Ringer’ as pictured. I am sure this is functional but I am returning it since it is not as described.
customer_reviews.author: Valeria

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for any cast iron skillet owner!
customer_reviews.text: I love my cast iron skillet, but I always dreaded cleaning it, so it would make me think twice before deciding to use it over my regular nonstick pans. I would randomly see chain mail like this draped over cast iron skillets in pictures both around the web and on Amazon, and finally decided to investigate. Turns out, this is what you’re *supposed* to be using to clean your cast iron skillet! The proof is in how simple and fast the cleanup is with this compared to other methods. I would recommend this to anyone with a cast iron skillet!
customer_reviews.author: B. T. Wade

customer_reviews.title: This thing is fantastic. It makes such quick work of the pan
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fantastic. It makes such quick work of the pan, feels nice in my hand while I clean, and isn't damaging to the surface like, say, steel wool would be. I also love that it is light and super portable, and it hang dries very nicely. I put it on a hook in my kitchen and could just the loop around, say, a tree branch for use camping. I've used it almost daily for a few months and it is as sturdy as the day I got it, so I really think it's gonna last me a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: It strips seasoning off!!!
customer_reviews.text: The Ringer does clean your cast iron. The problem is it also strips off the seasoning which defeats the purpose of the chain mail cleaner. To the trash it goes!!
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Serious crud buster
customer_reviews.text: When the nylon scrubber doesn't cut it for removing buildup on a cast iron pan, this is the ticket. It knocks back excess carbon without scratching it down to bare metal. I've also used it to recondition a couple pans that had been left stacked together for several weeks of saturation humidity. Cleaning the scrubber itself is easy because it can go in the dishwasher, I just drop it into the silverware basket before running a load and it comes out sparkling.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Culliton

customer_reviews.title: Good product - not used much in our home
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. But my expectations were high for this one. We were trying to move away from steel wool thinking that this can replace it. But it needs a lot of effort and is not Helping reach planes easily. It is also tough on our hands. But the best feature of this product is the cleanliness. Unlike steel wills which may carry lot of bacteria, this will start this way for life. Somehow not getting utilized much in our family
customer_reviews.author: Gee007

customer_reviews.title: Works Like Magic!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is an absolute monster! I have had zero issues with it over a month of twice daily use. I used this thing in the worst plausible situations I could imagine. It is magic for breaking up caked on food on ANYTHING. Just a bit of warm water, soap or no, and everything just breaks right off. It is aesthetically pleasing and cleans super easy. I absolutely reccomend buying this for your kitchen if you wash dishes regularly or deal with caked on foods.
customer_reviews.author: Draven Valverde

customer_reviews.title: Life-changing
customer_reviews.text: How have I lived my life without this product? I can tell you. I simply haven't. Every day before I owned this was a day of darkness as I toiled over my cast iron skillet, scrubbing salt and oil into it in futility, attempting to retain the seasoning but remove the grody leftover meat bits. Never again, I say. Never again. Anyway, you should but this thing. It's cheap and it works really well. The end.
customer_reviews.author: Nikol Hasler

customer_reviews.title: Honestly, why does the survey ask me to rate scent? does stainless steel have a scent?
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this, and that's all I need to know. It's lighter and the rings are smaller than the picture led me to believe, I expected more heavy-duty, but she uses it daily to clean the pots and pans, (I use it on the cast-iron fry pan) , and it does the job! maybe bigger here isn't better. it hangs off the dish drainer, and is always ready to get to work. Every home with pots and/or pans needs one of these.
customer_reviews.author: James T. King Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Best product for scrabbling pots
customer_reviews.text: I wish I found that product earlier. It makes cleaning so much easier. Not only for cast iron as it recommended, but I also use it for stainless steel pots and pans. It can be good for any durable surface I think. It's very easy to clean and dry and it seems that it would last for years unlike variety of sponges I used to use for scrabbling burn on pots. There's no smell to it and it takes very little space to store.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie A.

customer_reviews.title: Buttery Knights
customer_reviews.text: The tactile pleasure of cleaning with this is so much better than steel wool. It has a lovely sound and texture, especially when a little buttery. I told my friend that I’d gotten one, and she said that she has one that she loves. And how can you not love scrubbing grandma’s old cast iron with a bit of chain mail?! The mind wanders to the times of knights and grandmas and history and the ideas that spark invention.
customer_reviews.author: E.O.

customer_reviews.title: Hard enough to remove food, soft enough to not ruin seasoning
customer_reviews.text: Love using this scrubber with all of my cast iron pans. Have had no problems at all with it stripping my seasoning. After every use of my cast iron I run it under hot water (as hot as my faucet can go) and lightly scrub away any leftover food bits. My seasoning is pretty solid so usually there isn't much to scrub. After use I just toss this scrubber into my dishwasher and its ready to go again for my next meal. Cannot recommend this enough to anyone that is serious about maintaining their cast iron.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: The best way to keep your cast iron fry pan seasoning.
customer_reviews.text: This stainless steel woven “scratcher” works wonderfully to clean my cast iron fry pans. Just remove excess grease and food with paper towel. Add kosher salt, rub this into the fry pan sides and bottom until clean. Wipe clean with paper towel. Throw stainless steel “scratcher” in dishwasher or wash in hot soapy water. My seasoned cast iron fry pans stay seasoned and smooth inside.
customer_reviews.author: D. E.

customer_reviews.title: Great at cleaning, and causing intense pain.
customer_reviews.text: The Ringer does a great job of getting my cast iron pan clean. I don't need to use soap and it really gets off tough pieces of food etc. very well. The only problem with it I have found, is the intense pain that using it can cause. Somehow I keep getting one of the rings stuck under my finger nail whilst scrubbing and it's so painful, the pain also lasts for days and days, I'm wincing with each letter I type with my index finger right now... Seriously, it's worse than standing on Lego. Wear some gloves or something!
customer_reviews.author: N. E

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work pretty nicely
customer_reviews.text: I like this a lot; however one thing I wish it had was a ferrous ring or two. I have a magnetic knife holder that would have been perfect to store this, but everything is non ferrous. It does a pretty good job cleaning so far (better than the Kosher salt I used previously). It doesn’t seem to damage the finish.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: I'm a happy ringer
customer_reviews.text: This cast iron pan cleaner is really the bomb! It really does what it promises! Use it with no soap (which was always a no) and it really works and is easy to clean up in some soapy water and let air dry. I also have put it through the dishwasher with no problem! I do recommend this to everyone wanting to keep their cast iron skillets clean and seasoned for many years to come!
customer_reviews.author: 2thpickr

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with this product! I love my cast iron and carbon steel pans but have always been annoyed trying to get the gunk off in between cooking. I've used the Lodge scrapers and the Lodge brush. The scrapers eventually always crack or melt and just aren't great. The Lodge brush is completely useless. This chain mail makes it so easy to scrape off all the stuck on gunk without scrubbing off the seasoning. Super easy to clean and after months of use it shows no signs of wear. Absolutely recommend for your cast iron and carbon steel pans. You'll never go back to sponges, brushes or other scrapers.
customer_reviews.author: Connor Ames

customer_reviews.title: but works great for removing lime from the dog/cat water bowls
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected...didn't work out for my grandmothers iron skillet, but works great for removing lime from the dog/cat water bowls.....
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Buy one!
customer_reviews.text: I got three of these - one each for adult kids and one for myself. Everyone of us loves it. I'm a gadget person, so I'm predisposed to liking it, but my husband loves it - admitted it! And he's not a gadget guy. And, yes, put a little dish washing soap on it, dry your cast iron pan thoroughly when finished with it, and you'll be very glad you have this. Top quality, too.
customer_reviews.author: S'Librarian

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Cast Iron
customer_reviews.text: Didn't like using steel wool or heavy dish detergent as they left the skillet looking dry. This not only cleans but leaves and nice looking surface. I had a few hard spots on the surface from an earlier burn and this cleaned them down to the surface. Plus it lasts far longer than steel wool.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning my cast iron has never been so easy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kitchen tool to have for anyone who loves cooking with their cast iron pots and pans. It works great for scraping anything stuck to the cast iron, and is extremely easy to clean. I will buy again when this one wears out, but I dont see that happening anytime soon. I have had it roughly 6 months and there is zero wear evident. Likely will last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Tried 3, this one is the best. Easy to clean, right size and weight.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried three different scrubbers like this and use them for everything in the sink. One I tried had huge links and just skated over the top of stubborn food stuck to plates and pans, the one with really small links is harder to clean and doesn't seem to do a better job than this one. The Ringer seems to have a nice balance. Right size, right amount of grippiness, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Dutton

customer_reviews.title: The ONLY way to clean cast iron
customer_reviews.text: I was struggling with how to effectively clean cast iron without ruining the seasoning of the pan and I found this when searching and I can't say enough good things about it. I use mine all the time with just some hot water in the cast iron skillet and it removes EVERY trace of stuff in there. I bought more and gave them away as gifts to the other cast iron cookware users in our family. Kudos for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Viking54

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing. What started out as a breakfast caserole involving ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. What started out as a breakfast caserole involving cheese and eggs may have led me to discover a lightweight substitute for concrete. I soaked an aluminum pan and a pyrex pan for DAYS. Still would not come off. I ordered this scrubber, it cleaned both pans no problem. Perfectly sparkling, and zero damage. And zero chemicals! I was about to throw both pans away. If you have just had your nails done, I'd suggest rubber gloves. I'll follow up if my concrete substitute patent is picked up by NASA.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper555

customer_reviews.title: Dont watch the video
customer_reviews.text: In fact, just delete the hipster trash video. It doesn't do it justice. There, now for the review. I like it. I have used a few methods to clean my cast iron. Scrubby pads, kosher salt, Scotchbrite, plastic pan scrubber. I like how this cleans up. I had no problem removing pan residue after cooking with this. And cleaning up, yes. Just put it in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Rene Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Cast Iron & Steel Pan cleaning made easy
customer_reviews.text: Cast Iron & Steel Pan cleaning made easy, I have both and this is the best way to clean stuck on Foods without removing your Seasoning on the pan. Wipe it out, Through your pan on the Burner a little oil, A couple of drips heat your pan spread the oil out and let it cool your done, the key to cast iron or steel is heating the Pan after cleaning to prevent rust and promote Seasoning.
customer_reviews.author: Court

customer_reviews.title: LOVE it. It's very durable
customer_reviews.text: LOVE it. It's very durable, and I can use it on almost every dish I have. It doesn't seem to scratch even plastic, and it scrubs better than my plastic scraper or scrubby pad. Rinses out quickly and cleanly, dries quickly, and hasn't shown any signs of rusting or links coming undone. My only complaint is that it seems rather larger than it needs to be. half the size with a hang circle that isn't quite so big and it would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: jmwestplate

customer_reviews.title: I liked this so much that I ordered another for a friend.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't really know what to expect from this product, but I liked the feel of it immediately. I was used to cleaning my cast iron skillet with scraper. Getting into the curves was hard, but I just used my "ringer" and it covers everything. I love it! My skillet is nice and smooth again. It has a ring to hang it after use and that is handy also. Yes, I really like this so far.
customer_reviews.author: radrig

customer_reviews.title: Really works with Le Creuset
customer_reviews.text: really works with my le Creuset pan. I have the grill so it's not a smooth surface and there has been a lot of patina and difficult crusts to clean. Just with 1 use, I can remove 90% of it with hot water. Will redo it again when the pan is warmer after next cooking
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tough on the grime, easy on the pan
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I was tired of either stripping the seasoning off my pan or not doing an effect job at cleaning it, leaving some residue behind. After trying the ringer out after my latest cooking endeavor, I can safely say this product has met my expectations on doing a fantastic job of cleaning without ruining all the seasoning I had built up on my cast iron pan. A really great product I'm sad to say I didn't invest in sooner for my cookware!
customer_reviews.author: Alucard212

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cleaner that lives up to it reputation
customer_reviews.text: Surely a great product. There are so many good reviews on this. If you are planning on cleaning a really gunked up pan, please wear a glove. The black residue from cleaning didn't go away from my hands for more than a week. That tells you how well this clean up. Of course, it didn't require a lot of elbow grease but well worth it. Now I can regularly use this to avoid gunking up. And more reasons to switch to additional cast iron items, like griddle.
customer_reviews.author: Bay Area Cooler

customer_reviews.title: Not safe for cast iron
customer_reviews.text: Like many others on here, I got this to help clean my cast iron. That was a big mistake. I gave it a shot, and after using it (very gentle, mind you, just pretty much running it over the surface), I got many scratches and gouges out of the surface of my pan and had to completely reseason. Do yourself a favor and just boil water to get stuck on food loose, and then use a sponge with no soap. That combo will work great and not ruin your seasoning.
customer_reviews.author: Cygnus

customer_reviews.title: Product poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The item I received is poor quality. It scratched my brand new Lodge iron cast skillet. This product is not a good quality. At first I suspected the metal ring and I ended up removing it, but somehow I still find deep scratches on the surface of my skillet. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Timbela

product_meta.title: The Ringer - The Original Stainless Steel Cast Iron Cleaner, Patented XL 8x6 Inch Design
feature_bullets: PATENTED XL 8X6 DESIGN FOR DURABILITY. We don’t use just any chainmail. The Ringer uses premium grade never rusting stainless steel that is machine soldered, and built for strength. The machines that manufacture our patented product were originally intended to protect police officers from stab wounds. When life is on the line, you can’t risk chinks in your armor. We bring that same strength to your kitchen sink and believe in quality that won’t let you down

MADE IN NORTH AMERICA. When you buy the Ringer, you aren’t going to be left with some flimsy, hand-crimped chainmail made overseas which will pull apart and end up scratching your skillet with a rough ring edge. Most competing products are manufactured in China, leaving you with a low quality scraper. We searched worldwide to find the best quality around, and we found it here in North America. Simply put, The Ringer is set to last as long as your cast iron skillet

TOUGH ON GRIT, GENTLE ON FLAVOR. Wash off the grit AND preserve the flavor with soap-less, detergent-free grit removal. You don’t need to fear your seasoning being stripped off by harsh soap or cleaners. With The Ringer all you need is warm water and you’re good to go. Let’s keep your flavors in the family, not with the fishes. Works great in addition with cast iron seasoning or cast iron conditioner

MULTI-USE SCRUBBER, DISHWASHER SAFE. Kitchen sponges are 200,000 times dirtier than a toilet seat with 10,000,000 bacteria per square inch. Gross, we know. Don’t worry; this multi-purpose scrubber can be used for cast iron, glassware, stainless steel, a pizza stone, plates, baking sheets, a tea pot, cookie sheets, cauldrons, tortilla press, a hibachi, a waffle maker, a pie pan, a Dutch oven, griddle, woks, and casserole dishes. To clean, just throw it in the dishwasher

IRON CLAD GUARANTEE. We’re confident that you’ll love The Ringer as much as we do. Used and loved by cast iron enthusiasts world wide, we’re confident you will be just as obsessed. Aren’t Satisfied? Let us know and we’ll get you taken care of

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars8,838 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
